732574f-a.title: Pets - Donkey.
732574f-a.text:
Pets, Donkey: A donkey and a load of hay outside of stables on the south side of East 24th Street, between Second and Third Aves. This locality has long been known as a horse trading center, in fact ever since the removal of the Bulls Head Tavern from the lower Bowery to the N.W.
corner of Third Ave. and 24th Street.
January 25, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

711756f-a.text:
164-152 East 24th Street, south side, west of Third Avenue, February 4, 1928.  F.L. Sperr.

The same, at a later date and showing a further view westward. Note the erection of the new United States Post Office here. October 2, 1936.  F.L. Sperr

May 23, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

711755f-a.text: 200-222 East 24th Street, adjoining and east of S.E. corner of Third Avenue. February 4, 1928. P.L. Sperr.

708026f-a.text:

July, 1938
George D. Chinn
